alert.note: Alert for Bucks; Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 25 at 3:38PM EDT until July 25 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Bucks County in southeastern Pennsylvania... North Central Montgomery County in southeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 600 PM EDT. * At 338 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Quakertown, Perkasie, Green Lane, Pennsburg, Red Hill, and Trumbauersville. This includes the following highways... Northeast Extension between mile markers 38 and 43. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
